thanks_title: Thank you for this great solidarity!
thanks_msg:
We wholeheartedly thank everyone who worked, supported, showed solidarity, donated, and made sacrifices in their own lives for our child Furkan.

To all our volunteers who multiply kindness and call for kindness... Each and every one of you are heroes who held Furkan's hand.

May God be pleased with all of you. Thank goodness you exist, thank goodness you didn't leave us alone.

timeline_step4_desc: Furkan's dream turned into reality. DMD didn't win, Furkan did. Treatment fundraising goal achieved!

faq_a1:
Furkan Elmas is a 3-year-old child born in Gaziantep, who witnessed the February 6 earthquake with his family, and is originally from ReÅŸadiye, Tokat. He currently lives with his family in central Tokat.

Furkan's DMD (Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy) journey began when blood tests at 3 months of age showed elevated ALT, AST, and CK values. The DMD diagnosis was confirmed at 9 months through genetic testing. After diagnosis, his treatment was supported through nutrition management, physical therapy, and swimming to improve his quality of life.

For Furkan, whose mother is a teacher and father is a bank clerk, reaching Elevidys gene therapy, which received FDA approval in June 2023, was of vital importance. Therefore, a governor-approved campaign was launched and the necessary goal was achieved thanks to the great support of volunteers.

Today, Furkan is preparing for the treatment process he will begin so that he can move freely like his peers.
faq_a2:
Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD) is a genetic disorder that affects muscles. It occurs because the body cannot produce a protein called dystrophin, which is needed to protect the muscles.

Basic Information

  • Who is affected? Due to its genetic structure, it mostly affects male children.
  • When is it noticed? Symptoms are usually recognized in early childhood.
  • What are the symptoms? Motor difficulties such as delayed walking, difficulty climbing stairs, easy fatigue, unsteady walking, and using hands when getting up from the floor may be observed.
  • How is it diagnosed? A definitive diagnosis is made through CK (creatine kinase) testing and genetic examination.
  • How is monitoring done? Muscles, heart, and respiratory systems are regularly monitored by specialists; physical therapy and rehabilitation are important parts of the process.

Is there a treatment?

In June 2023, great hope emerged with the approval of Elevidys gene therapy for DMD. This treatment is a gene therapy option that can be applied to children who meet certain criteria, with physician evaluation.

Elevidys can currently only be applied in a few countries abroad, and the treatment process is entirely managed by specialist physicians.
